# Returning to DDL Server {#returning-to-ddl-server .title}

[](javascript:window.print() "Print this article"){.printArticle
aria-label="Print this Article"}

## Returning to DDL Server {#returning-to-ddl-server-1 children-count="0"}

If you would like to use the standard DDL server and transition Vector
off of the Escape Pod, please use the steps below. Note that
transitioning back to the DDL server will require either a Lifetime
License or a [current
membership](//support.digitaldreamlabs.com/article/344-all-about-memberships){target="_blank"}
for the robot that you would like to use with the Digital Dream Labs
server.

**NOTE**: These steps are for locked (production) robots. OSKR robots
must follow the steps listed in [\"OSKR Users - Returning to DDL
Server\"](//support.digitaldreamlabs.com/article/352-oskr-users-returning-to-ddl-server){target="_blank"}.

1.  Perform a Firmware Recovery:
    1.  Vector must be on his charger and plugged into a power source
        (be sure to push him right to the back of the charger - you will
        see the LEDs flashing).
    2.  Press and hold Vector's Back Button for around 15 seconds in
        total until the rectangle furthest away from the circle LED
        lights up blueish white.
    3.  He will reboot and show \"anki.com/v\" on his screen.
2.  Perform a Clear User Data reset:
    1.  Double tap Vector\'s back button. Gently lift Vector\'s arms,
        then set them back down. The CCIS (Customer Care Information
        Screen) will appear.
    2.  Pick Vector up off of the charger. Rotate one of his wheel
        tracks until the highlight arrow on the screen moves from
        \"Exit\" to \"Clear User Data\".
    3.  Gently lift Vector\'s arms, then set them back down. Rotate one
        of his wheel tracks until the highlight arrow on the screen
        moves from \"Exit\" to \"Confirm\".
    4.  Gently lift Vector\'s arms once more, then set them back down.
3.  Set Vector up and connect him back to Wi-Fi by following the steps
    [in this
    article](//support.digitaldreamlabs.com/article/114-video-vector-and-connection-how-to-set-vector-up){target="_blank"}.
